Today, two KC-135 Stratotankers will be conducting a flyover Central Washington's hospitals to honor our healthcare heroes on the front lines of this pandemic. The path can be seen and heard in Moses Lake, Yakima, Richland, and Kennewick from 12PM - 1PM.

In 2019, I introduced Savanna's Act with my colleagues @NormaJTorres and @RepDebHaaland. Savanna's Act aims to empower local, state, federal, and tribal law enforcement agencies to accurately investigate & solve the cases of #MMIW across the country. 

https://t.co/ehYMy4urFs

May 5 is a National Day of Awareness for Missing and Murdered Indigenous Women (MMIW). Across the country &  here in #WA04, Native American women face a disproportionately high murder and violence rate & they lack the federal resources to combat these heartbreaking statistics.

.@POTUS & @SecretarySonny are prioritizing America's farmers & ranchers by providing relief throughout the COVID-19 outbreak. In Congress, I am working with the Administration to ensure aid for producers is commensurate with their damages.

Ag producers in #WA04 are now eligible for SBA Economic Impact Disaster Loans. To meet the needs of our agriculture community, Congress is working with @POTUS and @SecretarySonny to ensure farmers & ranchers have resources to continue to feed the world. 

https://t.co/7qoBDm7zes

The Lodge at Columbia Point received a federal Paycheck Protection Program loan to keep employees on their payroll. With few guests staying at the hotel, the Lodge is rehiring employees to help remodel Grace Kitchen, a job training org for women.

Happy #ArborDay to #WA04! We have a lot to celebrate today & everyday. Through legislation like @RepWesterman's Trillion Trees Act, we can ensure that our trees & forests grow, stay healthy, and continue to provide benefits for generations to come.

As we observe #NationalParkWeek, I encourage you and your family to celebrate our nation's beautiful public lands and parks. While some of these sites have been closed to help prevent the spread of COVID-19, you can still explore them from the comfort of your own home.

Today, homebuilders across the country are participating in @NAHBhome's #COVID19SafetyStandDown to pause work & review safety guidelines for their job sites. The construction sector & its workers will help lead the U.S. toward economic recovery - while prioritizing safety.

While recreation sites may be closed, many of the trails & open forest areas of the Okanogan-Wenatchee National Forest remain open. Safely exploring these areas is a great way to get out & enjoy the public lands we are blessed with in #WA04. https://t.co/642uxAqlr7

“Fundamentally, rural communities believe in stewardship rather than activism; for them, conservation isn’t a 'cause,' it is a way of life.”

I am wishing everyone in Central Washington a blessed Easter Sunday, from my family to yours. https://t.co/JcMvxxUBsE

Our way of life in #WA04 is dependent on the mighty Columbia River. The Draft EIS will determine how we operate our federal systems along the river, including our hydroelectric dams. #DamProud

Rural hospitals in #WA04 are struggling to keep their doors open. 

I sent a letter to @USTreasury Sec Mnuchin & @SBAJovita  urging inclusion of rural hospitals in the Paycheck Protection Program & financial aid programs in the CARES Act. https://t.co/8yJplruQMm

As the article you quote notes, "Residential construction is a bright spot in jobs report," adding 2,000 jobs across the country. Unfortunately, none of that good news is coming from WA where residential construction is banned under @GovInslee's order. #HousingIsEssential https://t.co/fqUU6TNoaO
Join tomorrow for a discussion about how #HousingIsEssential with @OlympiaWatch: https://t.co/5NIEc7cTNA

The @NAHBhome represents homebuilders & residential construction workers across the country who are continuing to work - in most states - to provide housing and affordable housing options for millions of Americans.

https://t.co/Oc66Tb310p

Listen live at 3:30 PST on @610KONARADIO to hear about our #HousingIsEssential efforts + the federal response to COVID-19 and how it is affecting other industries important in #WA04 like agriculture: https://t.co/Wm9AxSCrWq https://t.co/qakOzRGcKW
My interview with @ShiftWA lays out some of the critical elements of the residential construction industry & how they can benefit our state's workers + our state's economy. https://t.co/ZBzzjHOhIW

.@WaSenateGOP Leader Mark Schoesler has it absolutely right: "We’re not asking the governor to prematurely and recklessly reopen every sector of Washington’s economy before the outbreak is contained..." (1/2)

Thank you @RepCorry! We share the priority of protecting the health & wellbeing of the people of Central Washington. By allowing residential construction to safely resume, we can also protect our economy. #HousingIsEssential https://t.co/1kvdGTfwXK

We hear you. @DHSgov has deemed construction as "essential" - now it is up to states like WA to do the same. Building homes & providing shelter should not be restricted during our response to this pandemic. #HousingIsEssential https://t.co/zTN0Vp0kiP

It's important to remember: Construction projects contribute much-needed resources to other crucial industries, like those working to keep paper products on our shelves. #HousingIsEssential https://t.co/airGxaAaY2

Many of our state's homebuilders & contractors want to get back to work on these housing & private projects. Why should we allow progress to be made on the new NHL arena in Seattle and not on developing housing complexes in Washington’s rural communities? #HousingIsEssential https://t.co/5Ytx3hwMUC

While I represent the communities and people of #WA04, it is clear that #HousingIsEssential across our state. 

https://t.co/Ney4H66SoC

Editorial boards at newspapers across the state agree: #HousingIsEssential. Allowing work to continue on housing + private projects throughout WA - and in rural communities like ours in #WA04 - is good for the economy & good for workers.

Washington is one of only 4 states that excludes residential construction from "essential" activities. @cathymcmorris and I sent a letter to @GovInslee, which was echoed by several local & regional homebuilders groups. #HousingIsEssential

https://t.co/QxOyyhat5H

I’m on a conference call with @BIAW2 to discuss how their members & employees are affected by the ban on residential construction. The message: Workers want to continue their critical work, and they can do so safely. #HousingIsEssential https://t.co/ok4s4y7Kip

Just as farmers work to put food on our tables, homebuilders work to keep roofs over our heads. Today, I will be sharing why I believe #HousingIsEssential & why Gov. Inslee should include residential construction as essential under the "Stay Home, Stay Healthy" order. https://t.co/Ji5H9YBAGk

Our local communities are stepping up to pay it forward to those in need. Donating meals for first responders, medical supplies, and household items for families are just some of the examples happening in Tri-Cities. Find out how to help:
